alert.note: Alert for Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 05 at 4:28PM CDT until June 05 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Taylor. * WHEN...Until 530 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 426 PM CDT, Radar indicated moderate rain with showers over the Merkel area in northern Taylor County. Rainfall up to one half inch has occurred, and additional rain on saturated ground could cause minor flooding in flood-prone locations. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Bitter Creek, Little Bitter Creek and Mulberry Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Merkel. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 267 and 274. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... crossings along County Road 400, crossings along County Road 283 and crossings along County Road 410. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
